newsitem.title: USA: NOTICE OF SALE - County of Westchester, N.Y.
newsitem.headline: NOTICE OF SALE - County of Westchester, N.Y.

text.p: SEALED PROPOSALS will be received by the undersigned Commissioner of Finance of the County of Westchester, New York, at his office at the Michaelian Office Building 148 Martine Avenue, Room 720, White Plains, New York, on

until 11:00 a.m. (E.S.T.) at which time they will be publicly opened and announced for the purchase at a price of not less than par and accrued interest of $100,000,000 Tax Anticipation Notes-1997, (the) dated Feb

1997, maturing December 11, 1997. Interest on the Notes will be computed on the basis of a 30-day-month, 360-day-year. The Notes will not be subject to prior redemption. The right is reserved to reject any and all bids and any bid not complying with the terms of the Notice of Sale will be rejected.

The Notes are general obligations of the County of Westchester. There is no limitation, either as to rate or amount, upon ad valorem taxes on taxable real property in the County of Westchester which may be required to pay the Notes and the interest thereon. The State Constitution requires the County of Westchester to pledge its faith and credit for the payment of the principal of the Notes and the interest thereon.

The successful bidder(s) will be furnished, without cost, with the approving opinions of the law firms of Whitman Breed Abbott & Morgan and Plunkett & Jaffe, P.C., Co-Bond Counsel, to the effect that the Notes are valid and legally binding general obligations of the County of Westchester for which the County has validly pledged its faith and credit and, unless paid from other sources, all the taxable property within the County is subject to the levy of ad valorem real estate taxes to pay the Notes and the interest thereon without limitation of rate or amount. Said opinion shall also contain a further statement to the effect that the enforceability of rights or remedies with respect to such Notes may be limited by bankruptcy, insolvency or other laws affecting creditors' rights or remedies heretofore or hereafter enacted.

A Preliminary Official Statement, Notice of Sale, and Bid Form may be obtained from the Office of the Commissioner of Finance of the County of Westchester, in White Plains, New York, at (914) 285-2756, from the offices of Whitman Breed Abbott & Morgan, New York, New York, at (212) 351-3236, or the offices of Plunkett &Jaffe, P.C., White Plains, New York, at (914) 948-7722.
